recordHist.change: The division of the manuscript into codicological units, catalogued as msPart elements, has been adapted from Wright. William Wright catalogued the fly-leaf for Add. 14,442, foll. 1-46 , fol. 1, in the same entry as foll. 2-46. These two parts have received their own entries in the Digital Catalogue.

head.note: This manuscript contains: The book of Genesis, translated from the Septuagint by Paul, bishop of Tellā or Constantina .See Monumenta Sacra et Profana opera Collegii Doctorum Bibl. Ambros., tom. i. fasc. i. Prolegomena in editionem versionis Syriacae ex textu LXX., p. iii. “ Paulus Episcopus Monophysita Telae Mauslath, aliorum fortasse opera adjustus, jussu Athanasii Patriarchae Monophysitae Antiocheni vertit LXX. in Syriacum annis 616-7 Chr., fortasse etiam sequentibus, in urbe Alexandriae.” Most of the books of this version have already been edited by Norberg, Bugati, Middledorpf, and Rördam; and an edition of the whole is now being printed by Dr. Ceriani of Milan in the work cited above. He has given a minute description of this manuscript of the book of Genesis in tom. ii. fasc. ii. p. xvii., etc. See also his memoir, Le Edizioni e i Maoscritti etc., p. 19. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 3 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

head.note: The division of this manuscript into codicological units differs from that of Wright's catalogue. Some parts of this manuscript may not have been differentiated by Wright.

msItem.editor: Paul, bishop of Tellā or Constantina
msItem.title: The book of Genesis, translated from the Septuagint
msItem.note:
See Monumenta Sacra et Profana opera Collegii Doctorum Bibl. Ambros., tom. i. fasc. i. Prolegomena in editionem versionis Syriacae ex textu LXX., p. iii . “ Paulus Episcopus Monophysita Telae Mauslath, aliorum fortasse opera adjutus, jussu Athanasii Patriarchae Monophysitae Antiocheni vertit LXX. in Syriacum annis 616-7 Chr., fortasse etiam sequentibus, in urbe Alexandriae.” Most of the books of this version have already been edited by Norberg , Bugati , Middledorpf , and Rördam ; and an edition of the whole is now being printed by Dr. Ceriani of Milan
in the work cited above. He has given a minute description of this manuscript of the book of Genesis in tom. ii. fasc. ii. p. xvii. , etc. See also his memoir, Le Edizioni e i Maoscritti etc., p. 19 .

msItem.title: Summary of contents
msItem.note: A summary of the contents is prefixed.See Chrysostom, Synopsis Scripturae Sacrae ; Opera, ed. 1834-8, t. vi. p. 373 ; Migne, Patrol. Gr., t. lvi., col. 317 , and Ceriani in the work cited above, t. ii. fasc. i. p. xiii .
Several portions of these capitula are missing.

msItem.editor: Paul, bishop of Tellā or Constantina
msItem.title: The book of Genesis, translated from the Septuagint
msItem.finalRubric: ܫܠܡ ܟܬܒܐ ܕܒܪܝܬܐ̣. ܐܝܟ ܡܫܠܡܢܘܬܐ ܕܫܒܥܝܢ ܘܬܪ̈ܝܢ.
msItem.note: The following passages of the text are missing: ch. i. 1—iv. 8, ix. 24— xvi. 2, xvi. 12 — xx. 1, xx. 13 — xxxi. 53, xxxii. 12 — xxxvi. 2, xl. 18 — xliii. 1, and xlvii. 16—1. 17. The lessons are rubricated in the text, the end of each being indicated by ܫ. In the ܩ̈ܦܠܐܐ they are noted on the margins. The text exhibits the critical marks of the Hexapla of Origen; and the margins contain the various readings of Aquila (ܐ), Symmachus (ܣ), and Theodotion (ܬ); glosses upon some words (e.g. foll. 24 a, 25 a, 27 b, 29 a, 30 a, etc.); and a good many Greek vocables, written in not inelegant characters. The tetragrammaton is expressed by ܦܝܦܝ.

physDesc.p: Vellum, about 8 3/4 in. by 5 3/8, consisting of 45 leaves, many of which are much stained and torn, especially foll. 3 — 6, 9, 10, 17 — 21, 35, and 46. The quires, signed with letters, were originally 13 in number, but several are now lost, and only ܝـ, ܓ, and ܝܒ, are complete. Leaves are wanting after foll. 2, 6, 8, 18, 19, 20, 21, 33, and 45. Each page has from 22 to 28 lines.

item.p: Vellum, about 8 3/4 in. by 5 3/8, consisting of 45 leaves, many of which are much stained and torn, especially foll. 3 — 6, 9, 10, 17 — 21, 35, and 46. The quires, signed with letters, were originally 13 in number, but several are now lost, and only ܝـ, ܓ, and ܝܒ, are complete. Leaves are wanting after foll. 2, 6, 8, 18, 19, 20, 21, 33, and 45. Each page has from 22 to 28 lines.

handDesc.handNote: This manuscript is written in a good, regular Esṭrangĕlā of the viith cent.
Many Greek vocables are written in not inelegant characters.

head.note: This manuscript contains: Part of the first book of Samuel, according to the Peshitta version. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 1 item.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Part of the first book of Samuel, according to the Pĕshīṭtā version
msItem.note: The missing portions of the text are: ch. ii. 29—xvii. 57, and ch. xx. 34 to the end.

physDesc.p: Vellum, about 8 1/4 in. by 5 3/8, consisting of 19 leaves (Add. 14,442, fol. 47—65 ) one of which (fol. 55) is much stained. Leaves are wanting after fol. 54 and at the end. Each page has from 19 to 21 lines.

item.p: 19 leaves one of which (fol.55) is much stained.
Leaves are wanting after fol.54 and at the end.

layout.p: Each page has from 19 to 21 lines.

handDesc.handNote: This manuscript is written in a fine, regular Estrangela of the vith or viith cent.
A few Greek vowels have been added by a later hand on foll. 48 b and 49 a (ܽ ܳ ܶ ܰ).See additions.

additions.note: N.B., items below may have been listed out of folio order in Wright's catalogue.

item.label: Ownership Inscription
item.p: On fol. 48a there is a note, recording that this book belonged to the brothers Matthew, Abraham and Theodore of Tagrīt:

p.quote: ܐܝܬܘܗܝ ܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܕܡܬܝ ܘܐܒܪܗܡ ܘܬܐܕܪܘܣ ܐܚ̈ܐ ܬܓܪ̈ܝܬܢܝܐ. ܙܒܢܘܗܝ ܐܝܟ ܕܠܝܘܬܪܢܐ ܕܚܝ̈ܝܗܘܢ ܘܕܟܠ ܕܦܓܥ ܒܗ. ܟܠ ܕܝܢ ܕܠܚܐ ܠܥܘܕܢܗ̈ܘܢ (sic) ܡܢ ܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ. ܢܗܘܐ ܚܪܡ ܡܢ ܬܠܝܬܝܘܬܐ ܩܕܝܫܬܐ. ܘܫܘܝܬ ܒܐܘܣܝܐ ܐܝܢ ܘܐܡܝܢ.

item.p: Just above this, there is another note, stating that in the year 1517 of the Greeks, A.D. 1206, twelve brethren from Syria entered the convent of S. Mary Deipara:

p.quote: ܒܫܢܬ ܐ̄ ܘܚܡܫܡܐܐ ܘܝܙ̄ ܕܝܘܢܝ̈ܐ ܒܢܝܣ̇ܢ ܝܪܚܐ ܥܠܢܢ ܠܕܝܪܐ ܕܣܘܪ̈ܝܝܐ ܕܒܡܕܒܪܐ ܕܐܣܩܛܝ ܬܪ̈ܥܣܪ ܐܚ̈ܐ ܕܡܢ ܣܘܪܝܐ.

item.p: Of the lessons, some are rubricated in the text, and others are marked by a later hand on the margin.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.
